name: hipjiverobot
text: I'm sorry I can't give this more than one chubby. Seriously, this made me laugh harder than the strip itself.

name: buttermoths
text:
This comment haunts me. Every midnight dreary, while I ponder weak and weary, and my mind wanders, I ask myself: Is there - is there balm in Gilead? - tell me - tell me, and do just that!'
Quoth twohundredninety, `a snap of the cap for the cat with the clap!'

name: mt85
text: I am honored to have given the 100th chubby. Well earned.

name: saint
text:
I can't believe anyone could ever lame this and still sleep at night.

bravo, sir

name: soticoto
text:
I can, though I didn't.
The comment fails to enthuse me... though it hardly surprises me that the general populace are practically masturbating over it... mindless drones that they are.

name: terriblerobot
text: Man, when are you going to drop the "I'm a gigantic asshole" shtick? I've seen you make comments that were genuinely funny, sometimes even insightful. But now it seems you exist for the singular purpose of proving just how much of a prick you can be. It's old, man. Give it up.

name: soticoto
text:
Look dude... sometimes when I voice my mind, folks find it funny... and sometimes when I voice my mind, folks find it dickish. Either way though, it falls into the same category of self-expression.
And I'm not going to stop being self-expressive just because folks are getting sand in their butts over it and seem to think it is all about them.
I mean c'mon... Do you honestly think someone as egocentric as myself is gonna be doing any of this for other people ?

name: terriblerobot
text: Heh. I was curious as to if you went out of your way to be an asshole, but hey, more power to you for saying what you think, and fuck everyone else. I can respect that.

name: terriblerobot
text: I think there is something massively fucked about the entire sentence structure of that post, but I'm not going to try and sort it out.

name: livingston
text: 250 from this kid.

name: ariamaki
text: Man, a little bit more, and twohundredninety will have a comment with 290 Chubbies. I would love to have been that user.

name: dissembly
text: We may never know who it was.

name: zem
text:
with the rap, probably.

man, Butters can not help but front all the time.

name: pkitty
text:
His self-image and sense of playah-importance are just unshakable , man -- it's so strong it's become a fundamental part of reality.

Just think about it. Even when he's filching some dude's ketchup to sneak a swig from it, he's 100% pure playah about it -- because, in his mind, this IS cool. (Of course, I'm sure a voice in the back of his head is reminding him, "Uh, yeah, this is totally cool behavior, man, but, uh... don't let anyone see you, okay? Check both ways before crossin' that street, bro.")

name: cheezeburger
text: I was thinking "DAP" just because it sounds good to me.

name: connormc
text: His activities are so poorly conveyed.

name: cpnglxynchos
text:
suggested*.

that's why we are all sitting here honking, wondering where the real biz is.

text: The only reason this is rated so low is because of the poor souls that really do prefer Hunt's over Heinz.

name: connellingus
text: What parts of this arc didn't make sense or follow logically for you? Mexican magical realism was an established part of the Achewood universe, and it explains why the helicopter with the luchador paint job acted the way it did, and we find out its origin in this strip. Butters being tempted here is the result of his established low class and predilection for Hunt's ketchup, and what happens to him because of his trespass is appropriate because he made Ray believe he was going to die soon at the beginning of the arc.

text: The third to last panel is one of my all-time favorite Achewood moments. The eyebrows are simply dynamite.

name: aperson
text: People quite often say this kind of thing in the comments here and every time they do it makes me feel sad. Because I'm the kind of person who can't remember jokes, so I'm equally unable to crack open the Achewood Excellent Phrase Resource.

text:

it's all i can retain.

text: But you don't refute the toilet seat part. Interesting.

name: atticusonline
text:
There is a reason you are part of The Syndicate

name: pkitty
text: "This... this could be a THING," has entered my vocabulary, though no one at my work understands what the hell I'm saying when I say it. All the better...

name: ford
text: One time some friends and I were coming off of an acid trip, and I was right at the point where the hangover was mixing with the last remnants of the trip.  Someone turned on the lights unexpectedly and in the sudden silence i said, in the smallest voice possible, "man why you gotta do a thing."  Everyone gaped for about half a second and then burst out laughing.  It was probably the best thing achewood has ever given me.

name: rad_chillies
text:
"a snap of the cap for the cat with the gat" is what i always say. it's a near rhyme, alright!

but come to think of it, 'cat with the rap' is probably what he would have said...

all the dialogue in this is classic!

name: sargasm
text: flip... NIP

name: kneejerk
text: This arc is SO underrated.

name: rotating-dog
text: Is SO good. Is SO funny.

name: kazad
text: I like how he has the move down where he just flicks the Hunt's bottle open, without his thumb.

name: soticoto
text: Only a Hunt's bottle could have such a flimsy cap as to make that possible.

name: jackparsons
text: What is that nipple thing on top of the aquarium?

name: stuart
text: It's a glass hood, and that's the handle.

name: chrissketch
text: From now on I am calling glass covers with round handles, nipple things. It will showcase my class when I am at dinner functions that make use of glass covers.

name: stormagnet
text: If we want to get real fancy, we could call it a cloche or a bell jar. But "nipple thing" is pretty brilliant, so let's go with that.

name: stormagnet
text: Oh, snap. My bad. Evidently, it's a Morris leaded glass fume hood.

name: nicolae
text: We have to "Catch Up" with Butters, you know?  Haha, because...ketchup.

name: falseprophet
text: This is reminiscent of 'Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.' Did anyone else get a warm Roald Dahl feeling during this arc? If so, does that make Roald Dahl a precursor of Mexican magical realism? Talk amongst yourselves.

name: mattylite
text: Yes, me too.  Same mixture of mostly benevolent/a little creepy.  The snozzberries taste like snozzberries.

text: I got a Don Hertzfeldt feeling. The last frame looks just like the final shot of Rejected.

text: Oh, my!  WHAT COULD HAPPEN NEXT?  The anxiety is horrifying.
